column4: deltah:is ya problem wubi related cos ive had quite a few of those:)
yes. its a wubi ubuntu installation that didnt shutdown correctly and prevents me from booting now
and u tryin to retrieve ya
yes trying to. hdd seems not broken, only ntfs is marked as in use
deltah:ok the way i no how to fix is install wubi again on the same hardrive as before... and in a folder on the same drive ull find a folder called found.000 and inside will be ya disks
deltah:u cud possibly do it off a live cd..
so i force mount via live cd? and reinstall wubi on same drive in same directory_
wouldnt that delete the information saved in my /home on ubuntu?
u can if u lik jus i install a new wubi ... and find the root.disk in that found.000 folder and replace the newly root.disk
ah, so the old one will be in found.000?  u sure about that?
deltah:if it crashed into grub4dos then the root.disk will be in a found.000 on ya harddrive
thank you for the hint, richy_
wow, quite a lot!! wouldn~t different partitions be better_
